column4: has anyone noticed that it take firefox much longer to load if u type, for example "hello" in the address bar rather than "hello;"
still about the same speed.. and I end up at "Hello magazine" either way
it's about the same for me
i'm sorry i meant "hello\"
but I guess both ways goes to google.. perhaps googling for hello is faster than hello;
- the bottleneck isn't google, its firefox taking 10 SECONDS! to figure out that it is not a url...
oh really... maybe its a ubuntu problem then and i am not off topic!
it doesn't on my machine
are u by any chance on 64bit?
yup, 8.10 64 bit
definitely more
for most stuff, yes.. I think so
tried reinstalling the nfs server ?
The error occurs when I try to start/restart the service, yeah
can you pastebin the output of "file /usr/sbin/rpc.nfsd" ?
Interesting. It's 0 bytes :|
seems you've found the problem =)
Seems I have - sorry, when you said "reinstalled" earlier I read it as "restarted"
ah.. try the --reinstall switch with apt-get.. or synaptic
removed/re-installed package, seems to work now. No idea how that happened, this is on a RAID volume so that's a worry
and they say computers are predicatble =)
